author: Special Correspondent
text:
Special trains

The Southern Railway has announced a pair of special trains between Madurai and Rameswaram on January 19 and 20 to clear extra rush of passengers for the ‘kumbabishekam’ of Sri Ramanathaswamy temple at Rameswaram in the district on January 20.

The Madurai-Rameswaram express special would leave Madurai at 11.30 p.m. on January 19 and reach Rameswaram at 3.30 a.m., the next day. In the return direction, the Rameswaram-Madurai express would leave Rameswaram at 4 p.m. on January 20 and reach Madurai at 8 p.m. the same day, a railway release said.

The special trains would stop at Madurai east, Manamadurai, Paramakudi and Ramanathapuram in both directions.
title: Madurai-Rameswaram special trains
